pullRequest.body:
Given a relation `r` on a type `\a`, the shortlex order over `r` on lists (first compare by length; if equal, then compare by lexicographic order over `r`) is defined. We prove that this inherits properties from the underlying relation `r` such as trichotomous-icity, asymmetry, order-connectedness. 

Most importantly, `Shortlex r` is well-founded if `r` is well-founded, giving a well-founded order on lists. (Notably, List.Lex is not well-founded). 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [df4f8c00c3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20310/commits/df4f8c00c343c2d11f211d7e23f69a1e9e8fda6d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.List.Shortlex` (new file)|589|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Shortlex`
`+ _root_.List.shortlex_def`
`+ _root_.List.shortlex_iff_lex`
`+ append_left`
`+ append_right`
`+ cons_iff`
`+ isAsymm`
`+ isOrderConnected`
`+ isTrichotomous`
`+ nil_left_or_eq_nil`
`+ not_nil_right`
`+ of_length_lt`
`+ of_lex`
`+ shortlexAccessible`
`+ singleton_iff`
`+ wf`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

The naming largely looks good now, thanks! (or at least, as good as the existing `List.Lex` naming...)

Perhaps @vihdzp has some opinions around the names of the WellFounded stuff, and whether some `instance`s are missing.
Some initial comments, sorry for not having time right now for a more thorough review.

The naming largely looks good now, thanks! (or at least, as good as the existing `List.Lex` naming...)

Perhaps @vihdzp has some opinions around the names of the WellFounded stuff, and whether some `instance`s are missing.

Just nitpicking here but you could write this as `rcases this with h1 | h2 | h3` which saves you the trouble of having to do another `rcases` two lines below. Same goes for line 165 with the extra `rcases` on 171.
oh nice, thanks!

```suggestion
theorem of_length_lt {s t : List α} (h : s.length < t.length) : Shortlex r s t :=
```

```suggestion
theorem of_lex {s t : List α} (h : s.length = t.length) (h2 : List.Lex r s t) :
```
or `of_length_eq` if you prefer.
I would guess you can make lots of progress here with `simp [shortlex_def]`
`simp [shortlex_def, List.Lex.cons_iff]` does the whole thing, wow!
The "exactly when" in this docstring describes a true and interesting theorem stated with `Iff`, but not the theorem below. Can you add the missing theorem in terms of this one?
oh, you're totally, right, I missed that! it's done now

```suggestion
theorem _root_.List.shortlex_def {s t : List α} : Shortlex r s t ↔
```
Otherwise `shortlex` appears twice in the name.

```suggestion
theorem _root_.List.shortlex_iff_lex {s t : List α} (h : s.length = t.length) :
    Shortlex r s t ↔ List.Lex r s t := by
```
The "of" naming is about implication only, not `iff`. You could add `of_length_eq` on the end here if you wanted, but I think it's fine to keep it short as there's no ambiguity.

```suggestion
theorem wf (h : WellFounded r) : WellFounded (Shortlex r) := by
```
since there is no way to infer `h` in your version, and the other two variables are already declared above.

These indents are unusual; better as
```suggestion
    · induction a with
      | nil =>
        cases b with
        | nil => right; left; rfl
        | cons head tail =>
          simp only [List.length_nil, List.length_cons, Nat.succ_eq_add_one,
            self_eq_add_left, add_eq_zero, List.length_eq_zero, one_ne_zero, and_false] at h2
```
Can you refer to these by their filenames, with `/`s, instead? I don't think docgen really knows how to parse this style of link.

pullRequest.title: feat : shortlex order on lists
